name: mistily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is full of mist (= small drops of water in the air that make it difficult to see into the distance): mistily atmospheric watercolours The island rose mistily out of the water.
in a way that is uncertain or mysterious, and often romantic: The first call of the cuckoo is greeted by us as something romantic and mistily mysterious. The songs appeal to those seeking a mistily uncomplicated vision of the past. See
misty
More examplesFewer examplesThe lights at the docks twinkled mistily. "Isn't it beautiful?" cried Peter as the village materialised mistily below us. "It was very enjoyable," he says, mistily.The captain opened his eyes and looked mistily about him.
